title: Provide a way to specify default extension dependency in case the user won't provide any of required options

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Description

We are getting the same problem with RR and RC options if we have an extension that can work with both but wants to allow user to pick their choice of either RR or RC when used with this extension:

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/24888
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/28744

It would be great if we could say in the extension (I'll use narayana-lra) the following:

* narayana-lra requires either resteasy-reactive-jackson or resteasy-jackson extension as a dependency
* if user specifies either of RR-jackson or RC-jackson use that
* If user don't specify any of the RR-jackson or RC-jackson use RR-jackson as automatic default dependency

In case of narayana this would be also the case rest-client extension so some generic approach would be preferred.

Possible in all cases of adding narayana-lra dependency including generating a new project or adding the dependency directly.
